page.title: 14ECOLOGY
page.content: There is strong feeling over the state of the river, the majority being unhappy with its present upkeep. Many people would be happy and willing to help with a voluntary effort to clear the river. People are generally satisfied with the state of the footpaths. Most people are in favour of more tree planting and favoured indigenous varieties such as horse chestnut, hornbeam, beech and lime. Many people are dissatisfied with the materials and design used in new and restored buildings in the village. Most people would like to see the Tithe Barn restored, but this would be a very costly scheme.
